text: A puppy has 12 bones and buries 5 of them. How many bones does it still have?
A squirrel collects 9 nuts in the morning and 6 more in the afternoon. How many nuts total?
A rabbit has 14 carrots but gives 4 away. How many carrots remain?
A zoo has 11 monkeys and brings in 7 more. How many monkeys now?
A penguin sees 15 fish swimming, but 6 swim away. How many fish remain?
An astronaut counts 10 stars and later sees 9 more. How many stars total?
A space rover collects 13 rock samples but drops 4. How many samples are left?
A rocket has 16 buttons, and engineers add 3 more. How many buttons now?
A moon base has 18 robots. Two go offline. How many stay online?
A spaceship launches with 9 astronauts. 5 more join later. How many astronauts?
A soccer team scores 7 goals today and 6 goals yesterday. How many total?
A basketball coach has 14 balls but gives 5 away. How many remain?
A tennis player hits 11 balls and then hits 4 more. How many hits total?
A baseball team has 17 bats and loses 8. How many bats remain?
A runner completes 13 laps and then runs 5 more. How many laps total?
A holiday tree has 12 ornaments. Kids add 5 more. How many ornaments now?
A child decorates 15 cookies but eats 7. How many decorated cookies remain?
There are 14 presents under the tree. Someone adds 6 more. How many total?
A pumpkin patch has 18 pumpkins. Kids pick 9. How many pumpkins remain?
A kid collects 17 Easter eggs but drops 6. How many eggs remain?
A child has 13 toy cars and gets 5 more. How many cars now?
A toy robot has 16 gears. The child removes 7. How many gears remain?
A kid builds with 19 blocks but uses 8 on a tower. How many blocks are left?
A toy box has 14 dolls and 6 action figures. How many toys total?
A child has 15 crayons and gives 6 away. How many crayons remain?
A racetrack has 17 cars. Three stop racing. How many cars still race?
A kid lines up 9 blue cars and 7 red cars. How many cars total?
A garage has 18 cars. Four drive away. How many remain?
A child sees 12 cars on the road and later sees 6 more. How many cars total?
A toy shop sells 20 cars but had 28. How many cars are left?
Pikachu finds 11 berries and Ash gives him 7 more. How many berries now?
Charmander sees 15 small rocks. Four roll away. How many remain?
Squirtle splashes 13 kids, but 5 leave. How many kids remain?
Eevee has 10 friends join her and 6 more arrive. How many friends total?
Bulbasaur has 18 leaves but drops 9. How many leaves remain?
Bluey has 12 toys. Bingo adds 5 more. How many toys do they have?
Dad makes 14 pancakes. Bluey eats 4 and Bingo eats 3. How many remain?
Bluey finds 16 butterflies but 7 fly away. How many butterflies remain?
Bluey has 18 crayons and gives 9 to Bingo. How many remain?
Bingo has 11 blocks and Bluey adds 7 more. How many blocks now?
Numberblock Five meets Numberblock Seven. How many blocks total?
Numberblock Eight splits off 3 blocks. How many blocks remain?
Numberblock Nine collects 6 stars and later collects 4 more. How many stars?
Numberblock Ten gets 5 balloons but gives away 3. How many balloons remain?
Numberblock Eleven rolls 9 dice and then 2 more. How many dice total?
A dog finds 13 sticks but loses 5. How many sticks remain?
A farm has 19 sheep and adds 6 more. How many sheep now?
A duck swims with 16 ducklings. Four swim away. How many stay?
A frog jumps on 15 lily pads but skips 6. How many does it jump on?
A cat sees 17 falling leaves, but 8 land. How many are still falling?
A rocket has 14 astronauts. Three leave for a moonwalk. How many stay onboard?
A space alien sees 12 glowing rocks and later sees 7 more. How many rocks total?
A space shuttle carries 18 boxes and unloads 9. How many boxes remain?
A moon base has 20 robots. Five go offline. How many remain online?
A starship launches 17 probes and retrieves 8. How many are still out?
A basketball team has 19 balls but loses 10. How many remain?
There are 15 cones on the field. The coach adds 6 more. How many cones now?
A swimmer completes 16 laps and then 7 more. How many laps total?
A tennis team has 14 rackets and gives away 6. How many remain?
A goalie blocks 11 shots and later blocks 4 more. How many shots blocked?
A child collects 12 candy canes and then gets 7 more. How many candy canes total?
A family decorates with 18 lights but 9 stop working. How many still work?
There are 16 presents. Kids open 8. How many presents stay wrapped?
A snowman has 13 snowballs but loses 5. How many remain?
A child gathers 14 Halloween candies and trades away 5. How many remain?
A toy box has 17 cars and 8 trucks. How many vehicles total?
A kid lines up 12 dinosaurs and adds 7 more. How many dinosaurs?
A child builds a tower using 14 bricks but removes 6. How many bricks stay?
A puzzle has 20 pieces but 11 are missing. How many pieces remain?
A child has 13 balloons and gets 6 more. How many balloons total?
A bakery makes 12 muffins, sells 5, then bakes 3 more. How many muffins now?
A chef chops 9 carrots, uses 4 in a soup, then chops 3 more. How many chopped carrots now?
A fridge has 15 apples. Kids eat 6, then parents buy 4 more. How many apples now?
A child packs 10 candies for a trip but gives 3 to a friend. How many candies remain?
A box has 18 crackers. A child eats 7. How many crackers left?
A family buys 14 festival lights, breaks 5, then buys 4 more. How many lights now?
A parade has 20 balloons. 9 float away, then 6 new balloons are added. How many balloons now?
A holiday stand sells 16 gifts, gets 7 more delivered. How many gifts total?
A Diwali display has 12 lamps. 4 go out, 6 are added. How many lamps now?
A kid collects 10 festival cards and trades away 3. How many left?
A drawer holds 16 forks but 6 are taken for dinner. How many forks left?
A chef grabs 12 bowls, uses 5, then grabs 4 more. How many bowls does the chef now have?
A kitchen has 18 cups. 7 break and 3 new cups are bought. How many cups now?
A cook lays out 10 napkins and later adds 6 more. How many napkins total?
A shelf has 20 plates. A child takes 8 to the table. How many plates remain?
A child has 14 books, gives away 5, then gets 3 new ones. How many books total?
A teacher has 18 books, lends 7 to students, then buys 4 more. How many does the teacher have now?
A bookshelf holds 20 books. 11 fall over. How many stay standing?
A child checks out 12 books, reads 5, and returns 4. How many books still with them?
A library carts 22 books to a room, removes 8, then adds 5. How many now?
A student has 13 pencils, gives away 6, then buys 4 more. How many pencils now?
A pencil case holds 15 pencils. 8 fall out, and 3 are added. How many pencils inside now?
A class receives 20 pencils and uses 9. How many pencils remain unused?
A teacher hands out 16 pencils, collects 7 back, then finds 4 more. How many pencils now?
A child buys 18 pencils. 5 break and 6 are given to friends. How many still with the child?
A student has 14 pens, loses 6, then buys 5 more. How many pens now?
A pen box has 19 pens. 7 dry out, but 4 new pens are added. How many pens now?
A teacher collects 11 pens from students, finds 6 more in a drawer. How many pens total?
A class has 16 pens. Students use 8, but 5 new ones arrive. How many pens now?
A child starts with 20 pens, gives 9 away, then finds 3. How many pens now?
A child has 15 cookies, shares 6, then gets 4 more. How many cookies now?
A fridge has 22 oranges. Family eats 9, then buys 7. How many now?
A lunchbox has 14 snacks. The child eats 4 and trades 3. How many left?
A kitchen has 20 apples. 11 are used to bake pies. How many remain?
A bakery has 17 pastries and sells 8. How many pastries left?
A festival booth has 19 lanterns, sells 8, then adds 6. How many lanterns remain?
A child collects 21 festival stickers, gives away 9, and gets 4 more. How many stickers now?
A parade makes 18 banners. 7 tear, but 5 new ones are made. How many banners now?
A holiday store stocks 23 items and sells 14. How many remain?
A New Year party has 20 balloons; 9 pop and 4 more are added. How many balloons now?
A kitchen starts with 18 utensils, uses 7 for cooking, then adds 4 new ones. How many utensils now?
A drawer has 22 spoons, 9 are removed, and 5 are added. How many spoons now?
A chef uses 16 bowls, breaks 6, and replaces 4. How many bowls now?
A kitchen buys 20 plates, uses 12, and buys 6 more. How many plates total now?
A pantry holds 15 cups, 8 are used, but 5 come back cleaned. How many cups now?
A teacher has 18 notebooks, gives 7 to students, and receives 4 new ones. How many now?
A class has 14 erasers. Students use 5 and then 3 new ones are added. How many erasers now?
A student collects 20 markers, loses 11, then finds 6 under the desk. How many now?
A teacher hands out 27 worksheets and gets 13 back. How many still out?
A school buys 24 rulers. 9 break, and 7 new ones arrive. How many rulers now?
Logan read 5 pages, then 4 more, and reread 2. How many pages did he read altogether?
Abigail planted 6 seeds, then 5 more, but 3 didn’t sprout. How many sprouted?
Jacob built a tower with 7 blocks, added 3, then 2 fell off. How many blocks are still on the tower?
Emily had 8 crayons, used 3, then found 4 more. How many crayons now?
Michael caught 6 fireflies, caught 4 more, then released 5. How many fireflies does he still have?
Sofia picked 9 apples, used 4 to make pie, then picked 3 more. How many apples now?
Daniel found 7 marbles, bought 6 more, then lost 3. How many marbles does he have?
Avery collected 8 feathers, dropped 3, then found 4 more. How many feathers total now?
Sebastian made 6 drawings, made 5 more, then gave 4 away. How many drawings left?
Nora had 10 beads, used 5 for a necklace, then found 4 more. How many beads now?
David baked 8 cookies, ate 2, then baked 3 more. How many cookies does he have?
Scarlett counted 9 birds, 4 flew away, then 6 more arrived. How many birds now?
Joseph read 12 pages, then 4 more, then lost his place and reread 3. How many total pages read?
Victoria picked 7 strawberries, ate 2, then picked 6 more. How many strawberries now?
Theo packed 5 snacks, ate 1, then packed 4 more. How many snacks now?
Natalie had 11 crayons, used 4, then found 5 more. How many crayons now?
Dylan collected 10 rocks, lost 3, then found 6 more. How many rocks now?
Hazel made 9 paper snowflakes, gave 4 away, then made 5 more. How many does she have now?
Eli saw 12 bees, 5 flew away, then 4 arrived. How many bees are there now?
Aurora found 8 pretty stones, lost 2, then found 3 more. How many stones now?
Hudson bought 6 balloons, popped 2, then bought 4 more. How many balloons now?
Violet had 7 cookies, ate 3, then baked 5 more. How many cookies does she have?
Hunter built a structure with 10 blocks, added 5, then 6 fell off. How many blocks remain?
Penelope planted 9 flowers, 4 wilted, then she planted 6 more. How many flowers now?
Levi had 11 crayons, gave 5 away, then got 3 more. How many crayons now?
Claire collected 12 seashells, gave 5 to her sister, and then found 4 more. How many seashells remain?
Owen had 13 marbles, lost 6, then found 2 more. How many marbles left?
Stella caught 10 fireflies, let 5 go, then caught 3 more. How many fireflies now?
Luke wrote 7 pages of homework, then 5 more, but erased 3 pages. How many finished pages?
Zoe found 10 stickers, gave 4 away, then got 6 more. How many stickers now?
Isaac picked 14 apples, used 6 for pie, then picked 5 more. How many apples now?
Hannah read 9 pages, then 8 more, and reread 2. How many pages total read?
Anthony bought 13 stickers, used 7, then bought 4 more. How many stickers now?
Lillian found 11 beads, lost 3, then found 5 more. How many beads now?
Jack built 8 towers, knocked down 3, then built 6 more. How many towers now?
Addison drew 10 flowers, erased 4, then drew 7 more. How many flowers are on her paper?
Wyatt read 12 pages, then 5 more, but forgot 3 and reread them. How many total pages read?
Samantha collected 7 marbles, found 9 more, then gave 4 away. How many marbles now?
Gabriel made 11 drawings, lost 4, then made 5 more. How many drawings now?
Ariana baked 9 muffins, ate 2, then baked 6 more. How many muffins now?
Paisley saved 14 stickers, used 6, then earned 5 more. How many stickers now?
Eliana collected 10 rocks, lost 4, then found 7 more. How many rocks?
Ezra wrote 12 sentences, erased 5, then wrote 4 more. How many sentences now?
Naomi had 9 crayons, lost 3, then found 5. How many crayons now?
Thomas saw 13 birds, 5 flew away, then 4 more arrived. How many birds now?
Ruby collected 8 shells, dropped 2, then found 6 more. How many shells now?
Asher built 11 towers, 4 fell down, then he built 3 more. How many towers now?
Bella made 7 bracelets, gave away 3, then made 5 more. How many bracelets now?
Xavier had 15 marbles, gave 6 away, then found 4 more. How many marbles now?
Leah saw 10 butterflies, 3 flew away, then 7 more arrived. How many butterflies now?
Evan colored 9 pictures, erased 4, then colored 5 more. How many pictures now?
Elise picked 14 flowers, gave 5 to her friend, then picked 3 more. How many flowers now?
Connor had 16 toy cars, lost 7, then got 4 more. How many cars now?
Sadie found 12 crayons, gave 4 away, then found 6 more. How many crayons now?
Isaiah built 10 block towers, knocked down 4, then built 4 more. How many towers now?
Caroline ate 3 candies from her bag of 11, then got 4 more candies. How many candies now?
Adam read 7 chapters, then 6 more, then reread 2. How many chapters read?
Aaliyah painted 9 hearts, erased 3, then painted 7 new ones. How many hearts now?
Christian picked 8 apples, used 3 for pie, then picked 5 more. How many apples now?
Autumn gathered 13 leaves, dropped 5, then gathered 4 more. How many leaves now?
Ezekiel counted 10 frogs, 4 hopped away, then 6 hopped in. How many frogs now?
Alice drew 11 stars, erased 6, then drew 8 more. How many stars now?
Ian read 10 pages, then 9 more, and reread 3. How many total pages read?
Ariella found 7 shells, lost 2, then found 6 more. How many shells now?
Roman gathered 9 sticks, dropped 3, then found 5 more. How many sticks now?
